text: A fast, multi-threaded OSINT tool that checks for the existence of a specific
username across hundreds of websites, presenting the results in real-time.
[cyan]<USERNAME>[/]             The username to search for.
[green]-o, --output <FILE>[/]     Export found accounts to a file ([cyan]txt, csv, json[/]).
[green]-c, --category <CAT>[/]    Search only within a specific site category (e.g., Gaming).
[green]--list-categories[/]       List all available site categories and exit.
[green]-p, --proxy <URL>[/]       Use a proxy for requests (e.g., [dim]http://127.0.0.1:8080[/]).
[green]-t, --timeout <SEC>[/]     Set request timeout in seconds (default: 10).
[green]-h, --help[/]             Show this help message and exit.
[#] Perform a standard search for a username:
[yellow]social-dive[/] [cyan]johndoe[/]
[#] Search only in 'Gaming' sites and save results to a CSV file:
[yellow]social-dive[/] [cyan]mastergamer[/] [green]-c Gaming -o results.csv[/]
[#] See all categories you can search within:
[yellow]social-dive[/] [green]--list-categories[/]
[bold]Important Note on Accuracy:[/]
This tool checks for usernames based on server responses (e.g., status codes,
or specific text on a 'not found' page). Many modern websites no longer provide
clear 'not found' errors to protect user privacy.
[bold yellow]‚ö†Ô∏è Be Aware:[/] This can lead to [bold]'False Positives'[/] (reporting an account
that doesn't actually exist) or [bold]'False Negatives'[/] (missing an existing account).
Always manually verify important results.
